abstract: Female victims of rape at Brigham Young University describe being punished in accordance with school's honor code after coming forward to report incidents; women's complaints have spotlighted university's treatment of rape as it seeks to uphold moral code, based on Mormon teachings, that prohibits extramarital sex and other behaviors deemed indecent.
lead_paragraph: The university is caught in a debate over the disparate treatment of sexual assault survivors as it tries to uphold a moral code at the heart of its Mormon identity.

headline.main: At Brigham Young, a Cost in Reporting a Rape
headline.print_headline: At Brigham Young, a Cost in Reporting a Rape

snippet: The university is caught in a debate over the disparate treatment of sexual assault survivors as it tries to uphold a moral code at the heart of its Mormon identity.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
